title: I can see why so many people are quitting league.
body: Not that riot would care about 10 or 20 people leaving since the game is so big, but a lot of people are quitting and I don't blame them one bit. Probably going to quit myself. The game isn't fun anymore. I try to have fun but it doesn't seem like they listen to the players one bit. Since the end of season 5, I have had a yasuo or a tryndamere every game. The masteries and items were made for the op to be even more op. They heal every hit and get the attack speed bonus every hit. Why? What was going through their head when they came up with these changes? - "Hey look, ADC's are in a fine place so lets make em super op. Lets focus the whole game around ADCs so that they can feel even more empowered. But lets make it so these op champs can stay op and lets not even care about mages anymore." SEASON 3 AND UNDER BEST TIMES TO PLAY LEAGUE. Season 4 had nice changes. But season 5 and onwards were just stupid. This is just MY OPINION so don't take it to heart and I welcome any discussion.

Nah, Tahm is basically the definition of what a tank should be like (excluding his supporty W maybe) lol. Pretty tanky with high damage, but totally unmobile so he probably wont be able to even hit you.

He's not a champ I overly dislike, but I generally don't like seeing tanks dealing so much damage actively.
That's not to say I don't think tanks should be able to deal damage.
For a long time I've strongly believed an optimal tank should do the most damage when they're taking hits
It's the best way to keep the tank from doing things like diving the backline and assassinating squishies while keeping their durability and damage fair

Not that there shouldn't be exceptions to the rule, but Tahm has some pretty toxic gameplay sometimes

How about give ballance some time. This is their biggest patch ever. How can you expect that this would be ballanced:

* The crit mastery what made yasuo & tryn so broken get it hotfixed this week, this will also effect the sustain of a lot of marksman arround the midgame
* Mages where extreemly strong for a fell seasons. Their damage ramped up to quickly while still providing a lot of utility. You still need mages in the game. The only thing that will change is a big meta shift. Now the game will be involved arround waveclear mages again like Ziggs & Xerath. They actualy buffing the keystone masteries for mages next patch.
* The reason why marksman are so strong right now is because their counterparts assassins are currently in the worsed state. Assassin need an markman size of rework to make them work in this game again. This isn't a problem that will be solved in a day. I honnestly wouldn't be supprised they wait till next season to fix this. One thing you must not forget and that are tanks/juggernauts. Last Whisper now only penetrates bonus armor. This means tanks with high base armor are uneffected by this. Try Tahm, Nautilus or Mundo. Their pretty strong against them.
